docs.text: Ferrofluid Speaker 2021-04-23 [DAKD Jung] creates a ferrofluid speaker . There's a build log on Hack-a-Day showing details of the build. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] E-Ink Clock 2021-04-03 [SQFMI] creates an E-Ink clock . ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] RGB LED Dice 2021-03-21 [Jean Simonet] creates RGB LED "smart" dice called Pixels Dice. The dice look to be open source hardware , with firmware for the dice and software to interface with them via Bluetooth available on GitHub . The dice know their orientation when they land and can light up accordingly. They can communicate back their position, opening the possibility of novel interfaces, such as speaking which face they landed on, and allowing custom light patterns for different rolls. [Jean Simonet] has videos on the creation process , including solder, casting and testing the dice. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Tiny Laser Cutter 2021-03-21 [Mike Rankin] creates a tiny laser cutter . Source is available on GitHub . ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Cute Translucent Computer Case 2021-03-17 Details are light but [sailorhg] creates cute computer cases and keyboards . bubblesort.io has more information as well. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Volumetric OLED Display 2021-03-02 [Sean Hodgins] creates a volumetric OLED display . ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Ultrasonic Microphone Jammer Choker 2021-03-02 [Naomi Wu] creates a cyberpunk ultrasonic microphone jammer that uses ultrasonic transducers to jam nearby microphones. Source code and design files are open source and available on GitHub . ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Experimental Bellow Instrument 2021-02-23 [Sam Underwood] is working on an experimental bellows instrument . ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Daily Basic-Bitch Quote Machine 2021-02-19 [llvllch] creates a daily basic-bitch quote machine . ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Automatic Water Dispenser 2021-02-19 [Chris Courses] creates an automated water dispenser ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] <<< previous posts >>>

docs.text: Machine Spirits 2021-02-19 Though the details are light, [s3msify] creates an automated drink mixer . ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Plastic Bag Blowing in the Wind Machine 2021-02-11 [MUDA-ZUKURI] creates a desktop machine that blows a plastic bag in the wind . ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Wolf Mask 2021-02-08 [@WillowCreative_] shows off a wolf head assembly ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Knitting Machine Automatic Color Changer 2021-02-08 [Sarah Spencer] and [John Spencer] create an open source hardware automatic thread color changer for knitting machines . The circuit board, design files and source code are available on GitHub . They also have some blog posts with more details on the machine and build . ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Protogen LED Helmet 2021-02-08 [ @Coelacant1 ] creates the start of a protogen mask and suit . The mask with a diffusor on can be seen in a later tweet . ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Animatronic Robot Singers 2021-02-02 Details are light but [natalie] creates animatronic robot singers . ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Mechanical 7 Segment PCB Coil Display 2021-02-01 [Indoorgeek] creates a mechanical 7 segment display using PCB coils a 3D printed housing and neodymium magnets. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Cyber Visor 2021-01-16 Not much detail but @CHA2trico shows off a stunning cyber visor that looks like a face shield with an OLED screen behind it. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] GETULA Chain Clock 2021-01-07 [Ekaggrat Singh Kalsi] creates GETULA, a 3D printed "chain clock" that morphs digits from a stepper motor fed chain. Hackster.io has a nice writeup as well. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Automated Touchscreen Tapping Robot 2021-01-04 [Jason Huggins] creates automated phone tapping robots . It looks like many if not all of the designs are open source hardware . Tapster.io has a suite of robots for sale. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] <<< previous posts >>>

docs.text: Flexball 2020-11-19 Flexball ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Smarch Glasses 2020-11-13 [samsonmarch] creates a pair of custom smart glasses to help with GPS navigation . ( github ) ( permalink src ) submitted by [abetusk] 3D Printed Light Marquee 2020-11-10 [Duke Doks] creates a 3D printed light marquee . The fonts are extruded and the letters re-positioned to have overlap. Each of the digits is then glued to the other, with access for the LED strip. The LED strip is glued to the side and a 3D printed inset diffusor is positioned on top. Each digit has a small platform to make sure the inset diffusor is positioned correctly. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Beating Heart 2020-11-10 [_caseyhunt_] creates an Arduino powered "beating heart" from a Smooth-On silicon mold of a heart and a small 9g servo motor: ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Infinity Mirror RGB LED Mask 2020-11-02 [Norman Wink] uses infinity mirrors, RGB LEDs and 3D printing to create a Halloween mask . ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] PCB 16 Segment Display 2020-11-02 [openKolibri] creates a sixteen segment display made of stacked PCBs. The sixteen segment display is a 100mm x 67mm display made from four stacked PCBs, with the top PCB being used as a diffusor. There are 128 0603 SMT LEDs that are driven from a TM1640 driver. See openKolibri's website for purchasing options. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Art Deco Earrings 2020-11-02 [sawaiz] creates art deco earrings that are motion sensitive. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Cyborg Ring 2020-11-02 [zakqwy] creates a cyborg ring . ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] LED Face Mask 2020-10-30 [Chelsea Klukas] creates a full face mask of RGB LEDs (for ~$160) ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Split Flap 2020-10-28 A DIY and free/libre version of a split flap display ( permalink src ) submitted by [abetusk] <<< previous posts >>>

docs.title: submitted by [abetusk]

docs.text: Mini Word Clock 2020-10-26 A mini word clock that could potentially be used as a wrist watch. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Tiny PCB Violin 2020-10-25 [Alexandra Covor] creates a tiny violin that plays songs from an onboard piezo-electic buzzer. MIT licenced under GitHub . ( permalink src ) submitted by [abetusk] PCB Stat Tracker 2020-10-24 [25albert] has created a table top role playing game (TTRPG) stat tracker . The board uses the PCB as a diffusor for the underlying LEDs. In addition, the top layer PCB overhang's flex is used to press the underlying tactile switch, creating a nicer user interface. [25alpbert] gives credit to [ Nick Poole ] for the clever PCB tips and tricks. ( permalink vid ) submitted by [abetusk] "Can The Subaltern Speak" Batting Eyelash Mask 2020-10-24 [Behnaz Farahi] gives details on the making of the "Can The Subaltern Speak?" mask . [Behnaz Farahi] writes: This project is inspired by ... masks worn by the Bandari women from southern Iran. ... these masks were developed during Portuguese colonial rule, as a way of protecting ... from the gaze of slave masters looking for pretty women. ... from a contemporary perspective, they can be seen as ... protecting women from patriarchal colonial oppression. Here the ‘wink’ of the sexual predator is subverted into a language to protect women from the advances of a predator. ... ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Sensor LED Ring 2020-10-24 [Joey Castillo] is working on an RGB LED sensor ring . [Joey Castillo] writes: ... it's four Dotstar LED's and an LIS2DH accelerometer. ... Still some issues to work through though: the big fail so far: for some reason the SPI Flash chip isn't working, so I don't have room for both the LIS3DH and Dotstar libraries ... running a rainbow demo, instead of reacting to motion like I'd hoped. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Ghosts and Bats Wire Pendent LEDs 2020-10-24 [ @jipraus ] creates wire ghost and bat LED pendents for halloween: [@jiipraus] also has a 10-minute youtube video on the build. ( permalink video ) submitted by [abetusk] Candy Launcher 2020-10-24 [ @GeekMomProjects ] uses laser cut parts and a patchwork of motors, gears and drums to launch mini candies. [@GeekMomProjects] writes: ... 3D printed cylinders with grooves for the orange rubber O-rings which I purchased. It's the kind of mechanism my son's VEX robotics team usually uses when their robot has to launch projectiles, so I figured it would work for this application. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] Singing Bowls and Servos 2020-10-24 [ Helen Leigh ] uses singing bowls, servos, LEGOs and electronics to create tranquility. [Helen Leigh] writes: I'm using a #microbit, a prototype of an extremely cute #LEGO compatible microbit breakout board from @BrownDogGadgets (which u can get on Kickstarter for approximately 15 more hours) and a pair of Geek servos. ( permalink ) submitted by [abetusk] >>>
A mini word clock that could potentially be used as a wrist watch. ( permalink )
[Alexandra Covor] creates a tiny violin that plays songs from an onboard piezo-electic buzzer. MIT licenced under GitHub . ( permalink src )

[25albert] has created a table top role playing game (TTRPG) stat tracker . The board uses the PCB as a diffusor for the underlying LEDs. In addition, the top layer PCB overhang's flex is used to press the underlying tactile switch, creating a nicer user interface. [25alpbert] gives credit to [ Nick Poole ] for the clever PCB tips and tricks. ( permalink vid )

docs.title: "Can The Subaltern Speak" Batting Eyelash Mask

docs.text: [Behnaz Farahi] gives details on the making of the "Can The Subaltern Speak?" mask . [Behnaz Farahi] writes: This project is inspired by ... masks worn by the Bandari women from southern Iran. ... these masks were developed during Portuguese colonial rule, as a way of protecting ... from the gaze of slave masters looking for pretty women. ... from a contemporary perspective, they can be seen as ... protecting women from patriarchal colonial oppression. Here the ‘wink’ of the sexual predator is subverted into a language to protect women from the advances of a predator. ... ( permalink )

[Joey Castillo] is working on an RGB LED sensor ring . [Joey Castillo] writes: ... it's four Dotstar LED's and an LIS2DH accelerometer. ... Still some issues to work through though: the big fail so far: for some reason the SPI Flash chip isn't working, so I don't have room for both the LIS3DH and Dotstar libraries ... running a rainbow demo, instead of reacting to motion like I'd hoped. ( permalink )

docs.title: Ghosts and Bats Wire Pendent LEDs

docs.text: [ @jipraus ] creates wire ghost and bat LED pendents for halloween: [@jiipraus] also has a 10-minute youtube video on the build. ( permalink video )

[ @GeekMomProjects ] uses laser cut parts and a patchwork of motors, gears and drums to launch mini candies. [@GeekMomProjects] writes: ... 3D printed cylinders with grooves for the orange rubber O-rings which I purchased. It's the kind of mechanism my son's VEX robotics team usually uses when their robot has to launch projectiles, so I figured it would work for this application. ( permalink )

[ Helen Leigh ] uses singing bowls, servos, LEGOs and electronics to create tranquility. [Helen Leigh] writes: I'm using a #microbit, a prototype of an extremely cute #LEGO compatible microbit breakout board from @BrownDogGadgets (which u can get on Kickstarter for approximately 15 more hours) and a pair of Geek servos. ( permalink )
